Hi, I'm Tim.

I'm a web developer living just outside Scranton, PA with my wife and dog. I've been developing web sites and applications for the past 12 years. I have had the privilege to work with some large and small ecommerce shops such as Solid Cactus, Web.com and FastPivot. I also co-founded two companies, Argyll Studios and Hosted Notes. The latter was successfully acquired in 2013. Most recenlty I was working at Plain, the team behind the Barley Editor and Unmark.

I'm currently looking for my next adventure.

Tim Whitacre

February 20, 2014

Current Loves : iOS Edition

Well, it’s finally starting to warm up here in Northeast PA and I’m neck deep in finishing a soon to be released update to Unmark (formerly nilai.co).

I get asked quite often by friends what are the most used apps on my iPhone. I thought this would be a great place to share them.

The image below is a screenshot of my actual home screen on my iPhone 5. I’ve had it this way for probably the last 6 months and don’t plan to change anytime soon. Although with the thousands of app developers out there… that could change tomorrow.

Here is a breakdown of some of my favorite apps.

Photo App - Camera Plus
Browser - Chrome for iOS
Weather - Check the Weather
Lists - AnyList
Reader - Pocket
Pod Catcher - Pocket Casts
Music - Rdio
News - Interesting
Mail - Default
Calendar - Default

I also do keep up on some social sites like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Foursquare and thus they landed a spot on my home screen. 

There are also many others I didn’t mention. If you have any questions or wonder what any are, feel free to hit me up on the tweetbox.
